thread.title_full: Music, Movies and Montreal: What to do in Canada this summer | Canada | Travel |

author: Canadian Press
title: Music, Movies and Montreal: What to do in Canada this summer | Canada | Travel |
text:
Films, musicals in Stanley Park this summer
VANCOUVER -- This summer's lineup of outdoor movies and musicals in Stanley Park ranges from Broadway hits to Hollywood blockbusters.
Theatre Under the Stars stages live musical theatre at Malkin Bowl, which seats about 1,000 people. For its 69th season, the non-profit group is presenting Oliver! and Hairspray on alternating nights from July 10 to Aug. 22. The top ticket price is $45. See tuts.ca.
At Ceperley Meadow near Second Beach, free movies will be screened on a four-storey-high inflatable screen each Tuesday at dusk from July 7 to Aug. 25. There's space on the lawn for up to 5,000 people for the annual summer event.
Musical Ride returns to Fort Walsh roots
FORT WALSH, Sask. -- The RCMP Musical Ride returns to its roots this summer with a performance at Fort Walsh National Historic Site in southwestern Saskatchewan, Parks Canada says.
In the 1940s the RCMP's Remount Ranch at Fort Walsh started the process of raising the police force's iconic, large black horses that are featured in the Ride.
The July 21 homecoming performance is among summer events marking the 140th anniversary of the fort, 55 km southwest of Maple Creek, Sask., off the Trans-Canada Highway.
Established in 1875 by the North West Mounted Police, Fort Walsh served as headquarters for that force from 1878 to 1882.
Passport to Montreal
MONTREAL -- A new passport for visitors to Montreal, covers admission to attractions and unlimited use of the city's public transit.
Tourism Montreal's Passeport MTL comes in two versions: 24 hours (for $64) and 72 hours ($109).
Also included is travel on the Trudeau Airport shuttle bus. The card can be bought at passeportmtl.com . Users must be at least 18.
